docs.title: Zubair
docs.text: The homebrew setting for our current campaign.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Fire elves that live in Mount Desolis and forge glass. Descended from fire giants.

docs.title: Notable Members
docs.text: Notable Member Description Mink Rosjen [[Mink's Artificer]] [[Mink's Muscle]] [[Mink's Rogue]]

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Lately Mink has been chafing under the gang's lack of ambition. They didn't help him rescue Rosjen and don't like how he is feeding into Mink's desires.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Total upstanding guy. Always in control of himself and surely not haunted by his past...or a ghost.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Forge Cleric Dwarf. Probably grumpy. Obsessed with some weird bauble. Keeps staring at it when he thinks no one is looking. Seems like an ok guy otherwise.

docs.title: Open Quests
docs.text:
• Learn more about Matt's Dwarf's weird bauble
  • Befriend Nate's Warforged
  • Keep an eye on Daniel's Warlock

docs.title: Magic Items
docs.text: Item Description Requires Attunement Currently Equipped

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Warforged Abjuration Wizard? Artificer? Always making cool trinkets. Reminds Mink of [[Mink's Artificer]]. Probably worth making a friend.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Criminal Lightfoot Halfling Ranger. Orphaned and made to find their own way in the world. Joined the military and left. Jailed for a crime he didn't commit. Broken out of jail by Mink.

docs.title: Notable Members
docs.text: Notable Member Description Mink Bard Rosjen Ranger Matt's Dwarf Cleric Nate's Warforged Artificer Daniel's Warlock Warlock

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The ancient desert kingdom. Strict hierarchy and the sole source of glass forged by the Azers in Mount Desolis.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Feudal warlords, strong navies, ancient culture and samurai/ninja vibes.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Big mountains. Tribes, dragons, villages, beasts, and home to the Ore Forge.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Rivers, farms, and beasts. Villages, towns, and cities with castles and some shmuck who has it all because of their birthright.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The isolated and cult-like institute of knowledge. Mysterious.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A big bad volcano. The Azers live under the mountain.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A deep canyon in among the towering peaks of the Farridge Mountains. Home to the Four Dwarf Kingdoms.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A growing republic and counter to the Lordlands.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Bay that Empyrean rests on. Opens to the wider ocean with connections to Wischyra, Peril Reef, and the Daimyo Aisles.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Hot and sandy canyons and orcs. Legends of oases and paradise. Nobody knows where it ends.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The capital of the Rivers Republic and the confluence of the two major rivers. The rivers join into Rowmore Run which flows to Empyrean.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Marshlands. Druids, goblins, and fog. So much fog.

docs.title: Notable Locations
docs.text: Location Description Farridge Mountains Mountains Ore Forge Four Dwarf Kingdoms Lordlands Game of Thrones Rivers Republic Counter to Lordlands Verdemar Capital of Rivers Republic Empyrean Best City by far (also worst city by far) Quimoira Elves Wischyra Druids and fog Minassos Mysterious Institute of Knowledge Gurbesan Azilon Mount Desolis The Mirror Sands Peril Reef Daimyo Aisles

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The anarcho-capitalist sin city positioned at the mouth of Rowmore Run as it flows into Talare Bay. Virtually all rivers from Zubair flow to Verdemar, where they merge into Rowmore Run which create the river delta upon which Empyrean was built.

The town grew haphazardly and a survival of the fittest form of architecture formed. Those who buttressed their land with boulders wouldn't get washed away with floods. Silty islands washed away with time.

docs.title: Locations
docs.text: Name Description Mink's Hideout The best of the best Old Town Poor Section Mid Town Wealthier Section Lower Docks Receive the bulk of goods and a great mixture of all sorts of folks can be seen here Upper Docks For the exclusive use of the elites Merchant Docks A little more upper class, but still open to all. Just less likely to see beggars and such. More likely to see armored mercenaries and higher guild members South of Mid Town Mercenary and Naval Guilds. Hire land or water based forces of any scale in this area

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Mink grew up here
  • Mink's gang still operates here
  • Mink met Rosjen here and freed him from jail

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Settled to escpare the Old Town riff-raff of Empyrean. Stone foundations with wood structures that are more finely built. Up to 6 stories tall with better built staircases and bridges linking the upper levels.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Hideout that Mink's gang uses. Located in Empyrean's Old Town.

docs.title: Notable People
docs.text: Person Description Mink Rosjen [[Mink's Artificer]] [[Mink's Muscle]] [[Mink's Rogue]]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The first area settled in Empyrean long ago. Mostly remains natural waterways and islands. Wood buildings can teeter up to 4 stories high with haphazard staircases and bridges linking the upper levels.
